SEARCH
Module flag4j
Package org.flag4j.arrays.backend

Class AbstractTensor<T extends AbstractTensor<T,U,V>,U,V>

java.lang.Object
org.flag4j.arrays.backend_new.AbstractTensor<T,U,V>
Type Parameters:
T - Type of this tensor.
U - Storage for entries of this tensor.
V - Type (or wrapper) of an element of this tensor.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, TensorBinaryOpsMixin<T,T>, TensorMixin<T,U,V>
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractCooSemiringMatrix, AbstractCooSemiringTensor, AbstractCooSemiringVector, AbstractDenseFieldTensor, AbstractDenseRingTensor, AbstractDenseSemiringTensor, CsrSemiRingMatrixBase, TensorOverSemiRing
public abstract class AbstractTensor<T extends AbstractTensor<T,U,V>,U,V> extends Object implements Serializable, TensorMixin<T,U,V>

The base class of all tensors. A tensor is a multi-dimensional array which consists of:

  • The shape of the tensor. This specified the dimension of the tensor along each axes. The number of axes in this tensor is referred to as the "rank" of the tensor and corresponds to the number of indices required to uniquely identify an element within the
  • A one-dimensional container for the entries of the tensor. If the tensor is dense, this will contain all entries of the tensor. If the tensor is sparse this will only contains the non-zero elements of the tensor.

See Also:

  • Field Details

    • entries

      public final U entries
      Entry data of this tensor. If this tensor is dense, then this specifies all entries within this tensor. If this tensor is sparse, this specifies only the non-zero entries of this tensor.

    • shape

      public final Shape shape
      The shape of this tensor.

    • rank

      public final int rank
      The rank of this tensor. That is, the number of indices required to uniquely specify an element in the tensor (the number of axes within this tensor).

      public abstract T set(V value, int... indices)
      Sets the element of this tensor at the specified indices.
      Parameters:
      value - New value to set the specified index of this tensor to.
      indices - Indices of the element to set.
      Returns:
      If this tensor is dense, a reference to this tensor is returned. If this tensor is sparse, a copy of this tensor with the updated value is returned.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If indices is not within the bounds of this tensor.

    • getRank

      public int getRank()

      Gets the rank of this tensor. That is, number of indices needed to uniquely select an element of the tensor. This is also te number of dimensions (i.e. order/degree) of the tensor.

      Note, this method is distinct from the DenseMatrixMixinOld.matrixRank() method.

      Specified by:
      getRank in interface TensorMixin<T extends AbstractTensor<T,U,V>,U,V>
      Returns:
      The rank of this tensor.

    • makeLikeTensor

      public abstract T makeLikeTensor(Shape shape, U entries)
      Constructs a tensor of the same type as this tensor with the given the shape and entries. The resulting tensor will also have the same non-zero indices as this tensor.
      Specified by:
      makeLikeTensor in interface TensorMixin<T extends AbstractTensor<T,U,V>,U,V>
      Parameters:
      shape - Shape of the tensor to construct.
      entries - Entries of the tensor to construct.
      Returns:
